com.wingfoot.wsdl.gen
Class BaseWriter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.wsdl.gen.BaseWriter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeploymentDescriptorWriterInstance, JavaWriterInstance
public class BaseWriter
extends java.lang.Object

Base class containing common methods used by DeploymentDescriptorWriterInstance and JavaWriterInstance. These classes both inspect the WSDLHolder to extract information and generate their respective output. They both use common methods.

isBindingSOAP

protected boolean isBindingSOAP(PortType portType,
                                WSDLHolder wsdl)
Checks to see if a the binding is of SOAP TYPE, either RPC or DOCUMENT
Parameters:
portType - The portType to check
wsdl - The wsdl which contains array of binding objects
Returns:
boolean returns true if this portType is a SOAP binding; false if otherwise

getStyle

protected java.lang.String getStyle(PortType portType,
                                    WSDLHolder wsdl)
Determines the style of the service. For a given portType determine if the style is document or rpc
Parameters:
portType - The portType to check
wsdl - The WSDLHolder

getMessageParts

protected java.util.Vector getMessageParts(Message message,
                                           WSDLHolder wsdl,
                                           SchemaConverterInstance sci)
                                    throws WSDLException
Takes a Message and returns a Java representation. The Message may have zero or more Parts. Each Part represents a parameter to a method.
Parameters:
message - to convert to Java.
wsdl - that contains the message. The wsdl is required because the message may be referring to a that may refer to another complexType in an imported WSDL.
serializedHolders - a Vector of SerializedHolder. This is the repository of SerializedHolders generated by the WSDL.
Returns:
A Vector which encapsulates a String[]. The encapsulated String[] has the following: string[0] contains the Type of the part string[1] contains the Name of the part string[2] contains the name of the JavaType. This is retrieved from Part.getJavaTypeName; has null if the Part does not have javaTypeName.

getElementFromSchema

protected Element getElementFromSchema(WSDLHolder wsdl,
                                       Part part)
This method returns an element from a part type which is an element.If the element is not found in the schema, then the return is null.
Parameters:
wsdl - The wsdl which contains all the schema components and elements
part - The part which contains an element instead of a type
Returns:
element An element to be returned

operationExistsInBinding

protected boolean operationExistsInBinding(Operation operation,
                                           Binding[] binding)
Checks to see if the operation exists inside a Binding
Parameters:
operation - The operation object
binding - Binding object
Returns:
boolean whether the operation exists in Binding
